The Foundation seeks to advance and encourage youth education Grants are made to organizations only
Grants of up to $3,000 Grants support research in astronomy and are awarded for the acquisition of astronomical equipment, computer time, computer hardware or software that will be used in research
The Foundation supports research by PhDs with an established record of publication in their specialties Any applicant must be associated with a recognized educational or research institution
Website provides a list of various awards, grants, and fellowships
Cash award of up to $500 to help fund activities Award given for chapters that raise awareness of Sigma Pi Sigma, encourage inter-chapter activities, increase the induction of new members, etc.
The Simons Fellows program enables research leaves providing time away from teaching and administration
Funds proposals that address cybersecurity from the Secure, Trustworthy, Assured and Resilient Semiconductors and Systems (STARSS) perspective

textAfterTable: Individuals may only apply for one grant per year Collaborative projects are eligible for funding Inquiry Form: Sept 15, 2015   Samuel H. Kress Mid-Career Fellowship Website     Research grant of up to $15,000 Funds research of mid-career professional on project relating to the appreciation, interpretation, preservation, study and teaching of European art, architecture and related disciplines from antiquity to the early 19th century, in the context of historic preservation in the United States.  Fall 2015         The Renaissance Society of America Website   The RSA offers residential grants and short-term research grants supporting research projects and publications that aim to advance scholarly knowledge about the Renaissance.   December 1, 2015       Education   Grant Description/Eligibility Deadline Carnegie Corporation of New York Website   The Carnegie Corporation has a funding program for "New Designs: Innovation in Classroom, School, College and System Design."
